name: DevOps Engineer
description:
About the company:

The company is a leading open-source blockchain explorer and analyzer, providing a comprehensive, user-friendly interface for viewing, confirming, and inspecting transactions on EVM (Ethereum Virtual Machine) blockchains. Our established product is used by millions, and we are committed to decentralization, making a difference, and staying on the cutting-edge of the crypto world.

We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to help us grow The company customer base and provide the best experience for engineers working with the product. This is a unique opportunity to join a small and experienced team of veteran engineers in the blockchain space.

As a DevOps Engineer, your responsibilities include automation of deployment processes, deploying product updates, identifying production issues and implementing integrations that meet customer needs.

Responsibilities:

  • Automate and improve development and release processes
  • Build tools to improve customer self-deployment experience
  • Implement requested integrations to meet customer needs
  • Deploy updates and fixes and monitor application health
  • Set up monitoring and alerting
  • Perform root cause analysis for production errors, investigate and resolve technical issues
  • Design procedures for system troubleshooting and maintenance
  • Setup and maintain EVM RPC nodes while monitoring their performance
  • Provide technical support to customers
  • Collaborate with development teams to improve the product

Requirements:

  • Proven work experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar software engineering role Strong background in infrastructure automation (we use Terraform and Ansible) Experience with cloud computing platforms such as AWS and bare-metal servers
  • Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
  • Knowledge of monitoring and logging tools (we use Prometheus stack and Loki) Experience with CI/CD systems (Jenkins, Gitlab CI, Teamcity, Github Actions) Working knowledge of databases and SQL (PostgreSQL preferable).
  • Experience in high load systems engineering.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Knowledge of EVM, Kubernetes, AWS, Ansible, Terraform, and GraphQL Familiarity with Elixir.

Our Technology Stack:

Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform, Ansible, cloud, and bare-metal servers, Prometheus, Loki, Cloudflare, Github Actions, PostgreSQL, Elixir, Rust, and NextJS.

Benefits:

  • Be an integral member of a strong engineering team.
  • Opportunity to create the most innovative and exciting products in the crypto market.
  • Highly competitive salary.
  • Attendance opportunities at Ethereum and project-based conferences and events.
  • Culture of learning and growth within the blockchain space.
  • Flexibility and autonomy in a decentralized work environment.
  • This is a full-time position that is 100% remote. Work from anywhere in the world.
  • EU time zone is preferable.
  • Compensation in crypto or fiat.

Stages of communication:

- Screening HR call.

- Online short brief-check (10 min).

- Interview Intro (30 min).

- Tech interview (1 hour).

- Offer.

Sounds like a great opportunity for your career development? Then go ahead and apply here - Valeria Volotkevich.
